. Previously Surathkal was separate town, but is now merged to Mangalore city corporation.
Surathkal is on the shore of the Arabian Sea. It is part of Tulunadu also called
in Kannada, meaning coastal region of Karnataka state.

Surathkal is the educational, industrial centre, which has the finest beaches. There is National Institute of Technology, Govindadasa college and Vidyadayanee High School. There are many factories like Mangalore refinery, Mangalore Fertilizers and BASF in and around Surathkal.
Visit beach in front of NITK ( formerly KREC ) and also Sadashiva Temple nearby.

value: Hotel Maharaja International ( Boarding and Lodging )
Akshaya Bar provide for great alcoholic ventures....

For classy ambience, Sadanand has an air conditioned bar attached....
The shady coffee shop Krishna at the gates of NITK serves amazing coffee and Lassi.
